tweets.text: Two survived trimming- the large one was way too soft, especially in the middle, and I ruined it. Back to work.
Gave these guys some time to dry, now they need to be trimmed. It might be a little early but I am impatient. https://t.co/vfT84zjf8H

I was really feelin myself off that first cup and proceeded to ruin the next 4 vessels I tried to throw. Taking a humbled break. The reclaim was very, very wet and I am too shy to figure out if there is any more in bags somewhere that isn’t obvious.
First piece wanted to be an espresso cup, maybe a little tall. https://t.co/zxRmf4d4HP

Once we have some wedged clay, set up a workstation. We hide in the back so the studio of expert potters don’t watch us fail to center for the 10th time in the last month. Chores are done. Everything is set up. Quick break. https://t.co/AZzx4GUfE0

First, gotta do my chores: measure out 400g balls from the reclaim (very wet today, maybe ill-advised) and wedge them. Trying a new wedge shape today (short cylinders instead of cones) https://t.co/vLOX2eRE2G
It’s the last day of the year… let’s make some pottery https://t.co/THHYoBmKG4

@mdavidallen I think we need to have a movement around creating your own online spaces, the way the slow food movement improved on McDonald's - we have given up so much and we are making ourselves miserable for their profit
@mdavidallen But I truly miss the old twitter where we would talk about what we were building or eating for lunch or whatever, that is so valuable to me
I grow weary of the zeitgeist outrage machine

All you people who say twitter should shut down someone's account every time they say something offensive terrify me. A lot. 

Why is it easier for you attack the medium than the message or the person putting it forward? Absurdly misguided.
